channel.title: Getting Started on DeepView Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Getting Started on DeepView Documentation

item.title: Installation
item.description: Installation Requirements Python 3.3+ or Python 2.7 macOS or Linux (Windows not officially supported, but might work) Installing on Mac or Linux First, make sure you have dlib already installed with Python bindings: How to install dlib from source on macOS or Ubuntu Then, install this module from pypi using pip3 (or pip2 for Python 2): pip3 install face_recognition If you are having trouble with installation, you can also try out a pre-configured VM.

item.title: Usage
item.description: Once you install the source code as shared in Installation page, you get a simple command line interface to run your face recognition use case. The basic construct of the Input folder is as follows: Unknown Photos – To keep the batch of photos which are unclassified Known Photos – To keep the batch of known photos. The classification of each photo is kept in a dfInputRaw.csv in root folder The algorithm stacks up the Unknown Photos into what is called Encodes.
